description: Inoculate with BM45 yeast (robust strain). Use 20g/hL at 24°C
Set fermentation at 24-26°C for Cabernet (warmer than Pinot)
Initial Brix (expect 25-26 for Cabernet)
Punch down cap 2x daily (strong cap management needed)
Monitor for H2S (lower risk than Pinot, but check anyway)
Add DAP at 1/3 sugar depletion (~17 Brix). Apply 75-150 mg/L
Maintain 24-26°C fermentation temperature
Monitor Brix at 1/3 fermentation (~13 Brix)
Continue punch-down 2x daily
Assess color development and tannin extraction
Monitor at 2/3 fermentation (~8 Brix)
Reduce punch-down to 1x daily after 2/3 fermentation
Final gravity (<1 Brix = dry)
Post-fermentation skin contact for 7-10 days (Cabernet specialty)
Add SO2 after post-fermentation maceration ends. Target 60-80 mg/L free SO2
Press pomace. Blend free run and press wines
Initial racking off gross lees
Inoculate with malolactic bacteria (typical for Cabernet)
Maintain 18-22°C during MLF
Monitor MLF completion (6-12 weeks typical)
